context.p: requires and stores its data in the following PostgreSQL databases:

li.p: The database (bss). This database is used for the actual business data, as well as for resources and configuration settings, for example, timer data.

ul.li: The JMS database (bssjms). This database is used for storing JMS data.

context.p: The databases are created by executing installation scripts. They need to be initialized with the appropriate schema and settings.

step.cmd: Make sure that the database server is running.
Open the command prompt (Windows) or a terminal session (UNIX/Linux).
Set the following environment variable for your current session:

info.p: DB_INTERPRETER: The absolute path and name of the psql executable of PostgreSQL. The executable is usually located in the bin subdirectory of the PostgreSQL installation directory.

step.cmd: Create the databases by executing the build-db.xml file in <install_pack_dir>/install as follows:

info.p: If you set a password other than postgres for the PostgreSQL user account (postgres) when installing the database management system, you have to specify the password with the call to the build-db.xml file as follows: <ANT_HOME>/bin/ant -f build-db.xml initDB -Ddb.admin.pwd=<password>
info.note: It may be required to enclose the -Ddb.admin.pwd=<password> command in double or single quotes depending on the operating system.

result.p: If the setup of the databases fails with errors, proceed as follows:

ol.li: Check and correct the configuration files.

Execute the build-db.xml file in <install_pack_dir>/install as follows:
<ANT_HOME>/bin/ant -f build-db.xml DROP.dbsAndUsers
